The most standard access to a filesystem: The most standard access to a filesystem located on the server.
Absolute path to the folder on the serve: Absolute path to the folder on the server. You can use PYDIO_DATA_PATH and PYDIO_INSTALL_PATH to point to Pydio default data path and root install path.
Create folder if it does not exists: Create folder if it does not exists
Optionnaly apply a chmod operation. Valu: Optionnaly apply a chmod operation. Value must be numeric, like 0777, 0644, etc.
Option to purge documents after a given: Option to purge documents after a given number of days. This require a manual set up of a CRON task. Leave to 0 if you don't wan't to use this feature.
Use system command line to get the files: Use system command line to get the filesize instead of php built-in function (fixes the 2Go limitation)
Delegates all download operations to the: Delegates all download operations to the webserver using the X-SendFile header. Warning, this is an external module to install for Apache. Module is active by default in Lighttpd. Warning, you have to manually add the folders where files will be downloaded in the module configuration (XSendFilePath directive)
Path to a directory on the filesystem wh: Path to a directory on the filesystem whose content will be copied to the workspace the first time it is loaded.
Option to purge documents after a given: Option to purge documents after a given number of days (even if shared). This require a manual set up of a CRON task. Leave to 0 if you don't wan't to use this feature.
Option to purge documents after a given number of days (if not shared). This require a manual set up of a CRON task. Leave to 0 if you don't wan't to use this feature.
Use php POSIX extension to read files pe: Use php POSIX extension to read files permissions. Only works on *nix systems.
Delegates all download operations to ngi: Delegates all download operations to nginx using the X-Accel-Redirect header. Warning, you have to add some configuration in nginx, like X-Accel-Mapping
Zip downloading files on the fly: Zip downloading files on the fly
Directly write the zip file to an output: Directly write the zip file to an output stream which is connected to the user's browser.
